patterns: What are the requirements for BSc. Architecture?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BSc. Architecture programme?
Requirements for BSc. Architecture programme?
What are the prerequisites for BSc. Architecture?
BSc. Architecture admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BSc. Architecture programme?
What are the entry requirements for BSc. Architecture programme?
Criteria for admission into BSc. Architecture?
BSc. Architecture programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Architecture
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Mathematics and any TWO from the following options:

    • Technical: Technical Drawing or Engineering Science, Woodwork or Metalwork, Building Construction
    • General Science: Biology, Chemistry, Physics
    • Visual Art: General Knowledge in Art, Graphic Design, Picture Making
    • General Arts Economics, Geography

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from the following Groups:

    • Either Three (3) Subjects from Group A (Technical /Science)
    • Three (3) Subjects from Group B (Visual Art/General Art) or
    • Three (3) Subject Combinations from Groups A and B A pass in General Paper is mandatory.

  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level or HND
    • An applicant must have demonstrated interest in the area of Architectural Design.
    • It must be noted, however, that experience at an Architect's Office or familiarity with computer drafting techniques alone is not a special advantage. The Department shall not regard these as substitutes for the minimum entry requirements to pursue a degree Programme. Applicants may be required to pass a written and an oral examination after pre-qualification exercise.

BSc. Construction Technology and Management programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for Construction Technology and Management (Building Technology)
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Mathematics and any Two (2) from the following options:

    • Technical: Technical Drawing or Engineering Science, Woodwork, Building Construction, and Metalwork.
    • Science: Chemistry, and Physics
    • General Art: Economics, and Geography

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in Mathematics and any TWO (2) from the following options:

    • Group A: Physics, and Chemistry
    • Group B: Geography, Economics, Technical Drawing, and Building Construction.

  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1) and (2.0) or HND.
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview. Candidates must also pass an interview.

BSc. Development Planning programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Development Planning
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) Elective Subjects as follows: THREE (3) Electives from Group A, including Geography or Two (2) from Group A, including Geography and One (1) from Group B:

    • Group A: Economics, Introduction to Business Management, Geography, Government, Elective Mathematics, General Knowledge in Art.
    • Group B: Accounting, Technical Drawing, Graphic Design, Picture Making, Sculpture, and Painting.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in the THREE (3) subjects from the groups below: Either all Subjects from Group A, including Geography OR Two (2) subjects from Group A, including Geography, and one (1) subject from Group B

    • GROUP A: Economics, Geography and Government
    • GROUP B: Mathematics, Statistics, General Knowledge in Art, Accounting and Business Management.

  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as follows.
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview. Candidates must also pass an interview.

responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Human Settlement Planning
  • WASSCE/ SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) Subjects in Group A including Geography, OR Credit passes in TWO (2) Subjects in Group A, including Geography, and a credit pass in ONE (1) from in Group B, as follows:

    • GROUP A: Economics, Introduction to Business Management, Geography, Government, Mathematics, General Knowledge in Art
    • GROUP B: Accounting, Technical Drawing, Graphic Design, Picture Making, Sculpture Painting

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes or equivalent in TWO (2) from Group A and ONE (1) from Group B, plus a pass in General Paper.

    • GROUP A: Economics, Geography, and Government
    • GROUP B: Mathematics, Statistics, Art, Accounting, and Business Management

  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application. Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0).
    • Higher National Diploma (HND), Construction Technician Course (Part III) or Professional Draughtmanship Certificates with a minimum of 5 years' experience in draughtsmanship.
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview.
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview.

patterns: What are the requirements for BSc. Land Economy?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BSc. Land Economy programme?
Requirements for BSc. Land Economy programme?
What are the prerequisites for BSc. Land Economy?
BSc. Land Economy admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BSc. Land Economy programme?
What are the entry requirements for BSc. Land Economy programme?
Criteria for admission into BSc. Land Economy?
BSc. Land Economy programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Land Economy
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE subjects from the following:

    • Economics, Geography and a third subject relevant to the Land Economy Programme, preferably Accounting, Business Management, Government, Business Mathematics, French, Literature in English, History, Building Construction, Technical Drawing and Mathematics.
    • Economics, and TWO (2) other subjects from the following: Elective Mathematics, Geography, Accounting, Business Management, Business Mathematics, Government, French, Building Construction, Technical Drawing, and General Knowledge in Art.
  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects, two of which shall be Economics and Geography, at a grade not below C. Preference will be given to a third subject in Mathematics, Government or History. Candidates must also pass the General Paper.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0), OR should hold a Diploma/HND in Estate Management.
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview. Candidates must also pass an interview.

  • DIPLOMA HOLDERS

    • Candidates with the Ordinary National Diploma (OND) or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Estate Management or other relevant Diploma qualification from a recognized University or Polytechnic with Cumulative Weighted Average (CWA) of 70% and above after a successful interview would be admitted into the second year of the Programme. Other Diploma holders with less than 70% as their CWA would be required to have three years’ work experience in the real estate industry and in addition pass an interview to be admitted into first year of the Programme.

  • DIPLOMA HOLDERS

    • Candidates with the Ordinary National Diploma (OND) or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Estate Management or other relevant Diploma qualification from a recognized University or Polytechnic with Cumulative Weighted Average (CWA) of 70% and above after a successful interview would be admitted into the second year of the Programme. Other Diploma holders with less than 70% as their CWA would be required to have three years’ work experience in the real estate industry and in addition pass an interview to be admitted into first year of the Programme.

patterns: What are the requirements for BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice programme?
Requirements for BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice programme?
What are the prerequisites for BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice?
BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice programme?
What are the entry requirements for BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice programme?
Criteria for admission into BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice?
BFA Fine Art and Cultural Practice programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BFA. Fine Art and Cultural Practice
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE subjects from the following groups:

    • VISUAL ART: General Knowledge in Art, and any TWO (2) Visual Arts Elective Subject.
    • HOME ECONOMICS: General Knowledge in Art, and any TWO (2) Home Economics Elective Subjects.
    • TECHNICAL: General Knowledge in Art, plus any TWO (2) Technical Elective Subjects.
    • SCIENCE: General Knowledge in Art, plus any TWO (2) Science Elective Subjects.
    • GENERAL ARTS: General Knowledge in Art, plus any TWO (2) General Arts Elective Subjects.
    • BUSINESS: General Knowledge in Art, plus any TWO (2) Business Elective Subjects.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in General Knowledge in Art and any TWO subjects.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application with at least THREE (3) years working experience.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0), OR should hold a Diploma.
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview. Candidates must also pass an interview.

  • HND APPLICANTS/DIPLOMA CERTIFICATE IN EDUCATION IN ART AND RELATED FIELDS

    • An applicant who possesses an HND in Creative Art or Equivalent Diploma will be admitted into the Second (2nd) Year of the Programme. Applicants must also pass an interview. Applicants may be admitted into the SECOND or THIRD YEAR based on performance at the interview.

responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Communication Design (Graphic Design)
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Graphic Design, General Knowledge in Art, ICT, and any other Visual Arts Elective Subject excluding Leatherwork, Basketry and Bead making.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in TWO (2) subjects including Art, preference would be given to applicants with THREE (3) passes at the 'A' Level with grade A or B in Art.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application with at least THREE (3) years working experience.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0).
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview. Candidates must also pass an interview and a practical examination.

patterns: What are the requirements for BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry programme?
Requirements for BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry programme?
What are the prerequisites for BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry?

Information on eligibility for BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry programme?
What are the entry requirements for BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry programme?
Criteria for admission into BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry?
BA Integrated Rural Art and Industry programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Integrated Rural Art and Industry
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from Picture Making, Leatherwork, Graphic Design, Textiles, Jewellery, Basketry, Sculpture, Ceramics, General Knowledge in Art, Management in Living, Clothing & Textiles, Food and Nutrition, Physics, Chemistry, Elective Mathematics, Biology, Technical Drawing, Woodwork, Metalwork, Religious Studies, Construction, Economics, History, Akan, Geography, Literature in English, Business Management, Accounting, Costing, and ICT.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in TWO (2) subjects including Art.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application with at least THREE (3) years working experience.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or 'A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0).
    • An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination at which they must submit a portfolio of Artworks showing interest in Rural and Industrial Art.
    • Candidates must also pass an interview and a practical examination

  • DIPLOMA HOLDERS
    • An applicant who possesses the Diploma in Rural Art and Industry High National Diploma (HND) in Education will be admitted into SECOND or THIRD YEAR of the Programme.
    • Applicants must also pass an interview or written examination or both.

patterns: What are the requirements for BA Publishing Studies?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BA Publishing Studies programme?

BA Publishing Studies admission requirements?

What are the entry requirements for BA Publishing Studies programme?
Criteria for admission into BA Publishing Studies?
BA Publishing Studies programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BA. Publishing Studies
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from any of the following groupings:

    • VISUAL ARTS: General Knowledge in Art, Picture Making and/or Graphic Design plus Textiles or Sculpture or Leatherwork.
    • GENERAL ARTS: Geography, Economics, Government, English Language, History, Religious Studies, French, Ghanaian Languages etc.
    • BUSINESS: Economics, Accounting, Introduction to Business Management, Business Mathematics and Principles of Costing and Elective Mathematics.
    • VOCATIONAL/HOME ECONOMICS: General knowledge in Art, Management in Living plus either Food and Nutrition or Clothing and Textiles
    • SCIENCE: Biology, Chemistry plus Mathematics or Physics

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in at least TWO (2) passes in the relevant subject areas as indicated in (1.0) above.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application with at least FIVE (5) years working experience.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0).
    • Candidates must also pass an interview and a practical examination.

patterns: What are the requirements for Metal Product Design and Technology?
Can you provide the admission criteria for Metal Product Design and Technology programme?
Requirements for Metal Product Design and Technology programme?
What are the prerequisites for Metal Product Design and Technology?
Metal Product Design and Technology admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for Metal Product Design and Technology programme?
What are the entry requirements for Metal Product Design and Technology programme?
Criteria for admission into Metal Product Design and Technology?
Metal Product Design and Technology programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for Metal Product Design and Technology
  • SSSCE/WASSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from the following disciplines: Visual Art, Home Economics, Technical, and Science.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in at least TWO (2) passes in the relevant subject areas as indicated in (1.0) above.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0).
    • Candidates must also pass an interview and a practical examination.

  • HND AND DIPLOMA CERTIFICATE IN RELEVANT AREAS

    • Applicants may be admitted starting either from the SECOND or THIRD YEAR based on performance at the interview.

BFA. Ceramics programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BFA. Ceramics
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from ANY of the following disciplines: Visual Art, Home Economics, and General Arts.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in at least TWO (2) passes in the relevant subject areas as indicated in (1.0) above.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0).
    • Candidates must also pass an interview and a practical examination.

  • HND AND DIPLOMA CERTIFICATE IN RELEVANT AREAS

    • Applicants with a certificate in relevant areas may be admitted to start either from the SECOND or THIRD YEAR based on performance at the interview.

patterns: What are the requirements for BSc. Ceramic Technology?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BSc. Ceramic Technology programme?
Requirements for BSc. Ceramic Technology programme?
What are the prerequisites for BSc. Ceramic Technology?
BSc. Ceramic Technology admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BSc. Ceramic Technology programme?
What are the entry requirements for BSc. Ceramic Technology programme?
Criteria for admission into BSc. Ceramic Technology?
BSc. Ceramic Technology programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Ceramic Technology
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in any THREE (3) subjects from any ONE of the following groupings:

    • Visual Art: Ceramics, General Knowledge-in-Art, and Chemistry or Mathematics or Physics.
    • Science: Mathematics, Chemistry, Physics or Biology.
    • Technical: Technical Drawing, Building Construction, Applied Electricity, Auto Mechanics, Electronics, Physics.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS AND EQUIVALENT

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) in Chemistry, Mathematics, Physics or Biology.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application.
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, as in (1.0) and (2.0).
    • Candidates must also pass an interview and a practical examination.

  • HND AND DIPLOMA CERTIFICATE

    • Applicants with a certificate in the relevant area may be admitted to start either from the SECOND or THIRD YEAR based on performance at the interview.

patterns: What are the requirements for B.Ed. Junior High School Education?
Can you provide the admission criteria for B.Ed. Junior High School Education programme?
Requirements for B.Ed. Junior High School Education programme?
What are the prerequisites for B.Ed. Junior High School Education?
B.Ed. Junior High School Education admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for B.Ed. Junior High School Education programme?
What are the entry requirements for B.Ed. Junior High School Education programme?
Criteria for admission into B.Ed. Junior High School Education?
B.Ed. Junior High School Education programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for B.Ed. Junior High School Education

    Options:

    a. Mathematics

    b. Science

    c. I.C.T

    d. Agricultural Science

    e. Visual Art

    f. History

    g. Geography


  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in any THREE (3) subjects from the following programmes:

    • Science, General Agriculture, and I.C.T. (for a-d)
    • Visual Art (for e)
    • General Arts including History or Geography, as may be applied (for f and g)

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from the following programmes:

    • Science, General Agriculture, and I.C.T. (for a-d)
    • Visual Art (for e)
    • General Arts including History or Geography, as may be applied (for f and g)
